    • Method Detail

      • extractSystem

        public static boolean extractSystem(File outputFolder,
                                    LoggerPan logger)
        will extract /system/app ,/system/priv-app ,/system/framework ,/system/*.sqsh files and build.prop of course system/framwork needs to be extracted so the only case this returns false is when it can't extract build.prop or framework folder or on a non zero adb exit code.
        Parameters:
        outputFolder - the folder in which the extracted files will be stored (needs to be a directory) the directory will be created make sure you have write acess
        logger - : the logger who will handle the logs and show them to the user do not send null
        Returns:
        boolean : true only if build.prop and framework were extracted

      • getDeviceName

        private static String getDeviceName(String out)
        will return only the device name from the output of "adb devices"
        Parameters:
        out - : must be the output on "adb devices" command
        Returns:
        deviceName the device name parsed from the out parameter

      • getDevices

        public static String getDevices(LoggerPan logger)
        Parameters:
        logger - : a LoggerPan to write the logging outputs (can't be null ! ) to by pass this if you wanna use a null parameter create a blank LoggerPan implementation that does nothing on the implemented methods
        Returns:
        device with status formated like this device|status

      • getDeviceStatus

        private static String getDeviceStatus(String out)
        will read the device status from the "adb devices" command output received as a parameter and return only the status value
        Parameters:
        out - : must be the output of the command adb devices as a string @see : AdbUtils.getDevices(LoggerPan logger)
        Returns:
        status : the Device Status

      • killServer

        private static boolean killServer()
        this will run "adb kill-server" and gets it's output returns true only if the adb exit code was 0
        Returns:
        serverWasKilled ?

      • startServer

        private static boolean startServer()
        this will run "adb start-server" and gets it's output returns true only if the adb exit code was 0
        Returns:
        serverStarted ?
